titlestmt.titleproper: Rockefeller University records, Assistant Business Manager, Correspondence, Series 2
A Guide to the Rockefeller University records, Assistant Business Manager, Correspondence, Series 2 FA806
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Lee R. Hiltzik

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2016-08-24 13:47:25 -0400.

revisiondesc.item: Migrated from Re:discovery to AT by Marisa Hudspeth

did.unittitle: Rockefeller University records, Assistant Business Manager, Correspondence, Series 2

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: The Assistant Business Manager records are arranged in multiple series:

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with personnel-related material restricted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: RAC users must abide by all applicable provisions of United States copyright law. Reproduction/duplication of archival items is routinely provided in accordance with “fair use”. If the RAC does not hold copyright for an archival collection, or items within a collection, it is the users’ responsibility to contact the copyright holder, or make a fair effort to do so, prior to publication.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: FA013 Rockefeller University records, Assistant Business Manager, Subject Files, Series 3
FA807 Rockefeller University records, Assistant Business Manager, Social Service records, Personnel, Series 5

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation note
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

controlaccess.corpname: Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research. War Demonstration Hospital

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: This series is arranged in two subseries:
2. Waldo Flinn - Detlev W. Bronk Correspondence, 1946-1953.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: For material on tryparsamide, See also: FA137 Rockefeller University records, Business Manager, Subject Files and FA214 Rockefeller University records, Director of Administrative Services, Roger C. Elliot, Reports: Bursar’s Receipts and Disbursements

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Limited access. Personnel-related material is restricted from scholary access.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This subseries includes brochures, correspondence, memoranda, and reports. Correspondents include Maxwell Barus, Wade Brown, Simon Flexner, Walter A. Jacob, and Louise Pearce. Subjects include Merck & Company, patent medicines, and tryparsamide.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Waldo Flinn was assistant business manager of the RIMR from 1927 until 1955 when he assumed the post of business manager.

Report - "Tryparsamide in Paresis and African Sleeping Sickness," by Wade H. Brown and Louise Pearce
Waldo Flinn - Detlev W. Bronk Correspondence

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Materials in this subseries consist of memoranda. Subjects include agenda items for the Board of Trustees meetings, 1955 study of animal case costs, the President's residence and social service matters for employees of the Institute.
